mc_pro_critic_reviews.summary: Everyone has piled into this dumber, sillier, more consistently funny reprise with an enthusiasm that’s infectious, and not in a low-grade medical way.
Dumb and Dumber To may not be quite as funny as the first one, but it’s the funniest thing the Farrellys have made since.
I’d be lying if I said this movie didn’t crack me up on more than a few occasions.
The Farrellys whip up a miss-or-hit affair, the best jokes coming without much set-up, just non sequiturs and malapropisms.

There are gags that work, that pay off in a big way, and gags that fall flat, derailing entire sequences. Because the world around them is so absurd, the film's attempts at creating some genuine heart for Harry and Lloyd doesn't really work.
Even this sequel, released 20 years after the original, had to up the number of poop jokes from the first film’s doozies in order to keep up with public taste.
Whatever the reason, the waning months of 2014 have brought us the follow-up to 1994's "Dumb and Dumber", but the lengthy gestation period hasn't resulted in an appreciably upgraded experience.
From time to time, it works.
Still, I laughed — enough to feel mortified at myself.
Over all, the movie is just funny enough to make you wish it were much better than it is.
The sequel sometimes feels like a series of gags ginned up by a gaggle of writers who are not always on the same page.
There's much more plot floating around during the sequel, all leading up to a climax at the "KEN Conference" that suffers in comparison to Silicon Valley's mockery of the same milieu.

The visuals remain homely and brutally efficient, the plot convoluted but the pacing brisk, and the humor often inventive and resourceful — and just as often tired or offensive (to women, people of color, gays and lesbians, old people, take your pick).

Even at its best, the film plays like the comedy equivalent of a legacy act reuniting for a tour fueled more by nostalgia and goodwill than inspiration. It’s less sequel than encore, and it’s probably time to turn on the house lights and close this buddy act.

Carrey and Daniels throw themselves into the characters they inhabited 20 years ago, whether it means allowing their crotches to be doused, using their rear ends as comedic weapons, or just saying really stupid things. Sometimes it’s pretty damn funny. Almost always, it feels just a little bit desperate.
Sporadically very funny, mostly very tedious, and sometimes truly vile, this 18-years-too-late sequel nonetheless exhibits a certain puerile purity of purpose.
The ultimate sad realization is not that Dumb & Dumber To doesn't match the original's good-time quotient, but that it might not even be as good as—yikes — "Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd."
Disappointingly limp, with precious few belly laughs, despite a try-hard attitude.
The jokes are far from fresh, yet the shock laughs are on a par with their inaugural outing and will undoubtedly appease fans of the original.
Every punchline is followed by a quiet pause for audience laughter, the lengths of which might kindly be described as optimistic.
Overlong and underpopulated with gags that really land, there's still moments of mirth for devotees of the original.
The misfires, including a strange menstruation gag, far outnumber the hits. Dumb and Dumber To is mostly just a kick in the nuts, and not the good kind -- provided there is a good kind.

The Farrellys are still not much interested in film as a visual medium, and when Lloyd and Harry aren’t smacking each other or dropping their pants, you might as well be listening to a radio play. There’s a story, but it doesn’t matter, certainly not to the leads or the good-natured sidekicks like Kathleen Turner and Rob Riggle.

Carrey and Daniels are good actors, and it's understandable when an artist wants to revisit a career-high point. How much you enjoy Dumb and Dumber To will depend greatly upon whether you think "Dumb and Dumber" was one.

The bad news isn’t that Carrey and Daniels got old, it's that the jokes did. The spirit is still willing in Peter and Bobby Farrelly, the original writer-directors, but  the sagging flesh is weak from prolonged repetition.

Truth be told, I was never a fan of the first “Dumber,” but the stars made it endurable and convincingly stupid. Here, they’re sometimes funny, and sometimes just sad. They’re better than this, no matter how good they are at hiding the fact that they know it.
So maybe some of this is hilarious. Heck, maybe all of it is. It will not be everyone’s cup of tea, and it was not mine.
Dumb And Dumber To is crueler, crasser, grosser, lazier, creepier, and, yes, dumber than the first film.

When the gags a movie is most confident in — the ones it uses three or four times, as if they were sure things — involve pushing unsuspecting pedestrians into a bush or riffing on "Bond, James Bond," something's wrong in the yuk factory.
To give the film its due, the stupidity is served up with energy and good pace. But it takes a thin premise and stretches it like Silly Putty. The title should really be "Obvious and Obviouser."
If there was any doubt that most things in society have been dumbed down in the last couple of decades, Dumb and Dumber To could be exhibit A.
This is anti-funny, where every attempt at a joke is like a little rock thrown at your face.
Before I go into the grinding awfulness of Dumb and Dumber To, let’s get one damn thing straight: The original Dumb and Dumber is a clasick.

Occasionally, particularly when it sticks to simple slapstick, the movie wins a laugh. But the majority of it isn't just dumb and dumber, or even crude and cruder. At nearly two hours, it's just dull — and duller.
From junky production values to the parade of unfunny supporting characters to its lazy energy, Dumb and Dumber To falls on its face.

The original film was unpredictable and loose and every so often gave up the aura of dangerousness. If anything, the sequel is a tepid, watered down, and at 100-minutes oftentimes boring attempt to recapture the magic but without any of the whimsy.

mc_user_reviews.text: They're back, 20 years later and as dumb as ever. Unfortunately, not as funny. This time they set out to find Harry's long-lost daughter, but not without silly complications. There are a funny moments scattered around and the duo still brings plenty of goofy energy. It's just that more of the jokes fall flat than land a laff. At least they didn't stoop to the current trend in gross-outs gags, but went for the classic stupid characters.

This resurrection of an originally abysmal film confirms the lack of new material for original comedies from the decaying hallways of Hollywood studio's. Dumb and Dumber To would be the perfect film to watch when you are feeling exceptionally happy and you would like to lower your mood to the depths of clinical depression. Go and decorate your home, sit down and watch the paint for hours until dry, it will definitely provide more laughs.

Do not understand the hate this movie is receiving. In my humble opinion, the only thing not to like is if you just do not like jim carrey. Other then that, I laughed the entire time. No I am not affiliated in any way with the peeps whom made it, just like to support and encourage more comedies like this one.
Well,I still laughed but the movie is just not what I expect.Jim Carrey & Jeff Daniels' chemistry of they're character are still fantastic but the plot and the jokes are just flat.

Love the original, but this is beyond dumb. At least the first one wasn't trying to be dumb as much as it just was. This is forcibly dumb and it comes across like each joke was dissected by a room full of writers and execs. This sequel should have come out 10 years ago, much like the Anchorman sequel and severely lost the audience.

Dumb and Dumber To isn't as funny as the first, but it has its moments.  Some parts of the movie are friggin' hilarious, while other parts it seems like Jim Carrey and Jeff Daniels are trying too hard.  Still worth going to see.

I didnt think it was that bad people are too judgmental. It obviously not even compared to the first one but walking in I was not expecting that. It has lots of funny parts in the movie the story was not half bad.

lol, such a creatively funny movie. Reminded me of a time when comedies used to take risks. Typically in the 2000s comedies would play it safe, recycling jokes to please people with one track minds. The marketing cleverly disguised this film as a dumbed down, lazy movie to entertain the facebook, instant access, and 0 punchline generation. The critics are even doing their job into pitching this film as a tired forgettable cash grab. Want the truth? Go see the movie.

This is one of those rare instances where I strongly disagree with the Film Critics. Dumb and Dumber To is easily one of the funniest comedies I have seen in years. The Hangover, Horrible Bosses, 21 Jump Street, and other recent examples are limp by comparison. It may not be to everyone's taste, but it isn't trying to stray from the source material. The original was mean spirited, low-brow, over-the-top and at times, obnoxious. Why critics are using these things as points AGAINST this sequel is mind-boggling to me. Dumb and Dumber To is the sequel that the franchise deserved. It may not be nearly as good as the original but it is leaps and bounds better than Dumb and Dumberer, which is all any true fan could ask for. If you're hesitant to see the movie because of average reviews, ask yourself if the original film holds a place in your heart. If it does, get yourself to the theatre and expect to laugh from beginning to end.

I am such a huge fan of the original film but I was not expecting this one to be better than the original at all!! I left the theater very underwhelmed and feeling guilty that I didn't laugh more because I wanted it to be good so bad. This is not a terrible film by any means. It is awesome to see Harry and Lloyd back together again and I did laugh quite a bit but there were too many times where the jokes missed and the movie fell flat on its face. It also fell way to familiar to the original plot wise and just didn't have many clever jokes like the original did. All in all this is a very mediocre film and I would only recommend renting it

Out of all the movies I've seen recently, Dumb and Dumber To is the one that most frequently flashes through my memory with bright, pleasant images.  Whether it's technically great or not, it is a good-hearted sincere attempt to give the audience a good time, and that's really all I ask of any movie

I really enjoyed the movie, I don't understand the harsh reviews. It was great to see Lloyd and harry back, I found myself laughing at their dumb antics. Its not the greatest comedy ever, but it is an enjoyable movie that I would have no problems watching again.

One somber chuckle in almost two hours, you'd think you'd been watching drama. This unfunny sequel pays no homage to its cult predecessor, and you soon realise that the only thing that's dumb is the writing. Jim Carrey was also disappointing, exaggerating too much and resulting in a parody of himself - but the true blame for this colossal flop is definitely going to fall on the writers, who cheaply recycled the plot from the original and wrote one single funny scene.
The first dumb and dumber was one of my favorite comedies. Dumb and dumber 2 is just so bad. I couldn't even watch the whole thing. I made it through only 35 minutes and just had to walk out.

Just a terrible movie. The humor terribly dry and was not funny, and not worth making fun of. Maybe it would be funny for some 12 year old boys, but it was the stupidest thing. It was literally the worst movie I have seen to date. Parts that were meant to be funny were just awkward, and not in a good way. The movie was bad. Please just do not watch this movie.

I loved it. As a long time Dumb and Dumber fan, I was satisfied. Sure I would have done some things differently but that is what happens when you become attached to someone else's art. Of course they aren't going to get it 100% right for everyone. BUT I THINK THEY GOT REALLY CLOSE. I went to the movie expecting to laugh, and I did. I loved it. The movie is dirtier than the first. So yes their innocence is a little gone but the US in general is dirtier than it was 20 yrs ago. Gas was 1.09 then its 3.09 now. Lloyd Christmas was always an opportunist at Harry Dunne's expense.

I literally felt dumb and dumber after walking out of this disappointing and mediocre 20-year reunion with Jim Carey and Jeff Daniel's two beloved cult characters from the ever superior first film. To sum it up shortly, I honestly only laughed out loud during one scene while the rest of the forced gags fell flat on their faces, not to mention they got a little more gross than I would've liked. Overall, while I was entertained for a majority of it, just go home and re-watch the first film because this one just simply isn't worth a trip to the theater if you ask me.

Great movie, as always Jim Carrey is Hilarious as is Jeff Daniels.. Almost as good the first but time will only tell if people see it up above the first or not.. People just need to calm down with negativity here
If you liked the first movie, you will like this too! ... I had not laughed that much time with a film of Jim Carrey, the chemistry between him and Jeff Daniel is excellent!
Same type of gags and comedy. If you like the first one it's more of the same. Some really funny gags in it. It does drag a little towards the end. Overall pretty good.

Great original gags that will get you laughing. Nice throwback that gives an aura of watching a later 3 stooges short. Easily my fav silly comedy of the year. My only complaint is that it ends on a down note.
The second film is as good as the first one, i believe this is the best comedy i saw this year, actually i dont like comedies so much but i will make an exception to dumb and dumber.

Was this laugh out loud funny....no. Was it at least "chuckleable?" yes. Was it better than the first...resounding no. Hard to follow a near classic with another near classic....especially 20 years later. Many similarities of plot, scenes and even characters as in the first one. Movie moved at a good pace even had some good songs in the sound track. Good enough for one watch and forgetting about the outside world for the duration of this movie.

Just awful. The first one hat at least some charm, and characters were innovative for tat time. This "number two" is just a way for the studio to earn some money. It's sad and stupid to watch. Maybe if you are 9 years old you would find some of the simple humor funny.
Great movie! What the heck are all the critics **** about?! Consistantly funny from beginning to end. As good as the first? No, but that is asking a lot. Hope they make another.

Started off not so great. Some of the humor wasn't funny in the beginning. However once they hit the road it gets a lot better. If there ever is a third movie though please ditch all the old gags. Never understand why they have to reuse them in different contexts. If the new generation want to see them, just repackage and resell the first movie.

When I watched Dumb and Dumber for the first time I was a child who was dying of laughs at the jokes of Jeff Daniels and especially the genius Jim Carrey. Surprisingly, 20 years later I still enjoy and put the movie easily on my personal list of the best comedies of all time. But what I felt with this Dumb and Dumber To was a feeling of helplessness. Jim Carrey and Jeff Daniels are still clean and the chemistry between the two is simply amazing. However, the film piece with holes in the script, forced moments and unnecessary clichés. Yet it is a good movie for fun, but it is absolutely less than the first film, even trying to copy the way blatantly.

What's the #1 thing I want out of comedies? Answer: to make me laugh my ass off! Dumb and Dumber To accomplishes this with ease, just like the first one. Am I saying the movie is as good the first one? No, but is it as enjoyable? Very close. Jim Carrey and Jeff Daniels reprise their iconic roles that everyone loved them for, and I swear, their acting and chemistry here is like they made the movie a day after the first one. I can't imagine the duo being any different. It's so great to see Carrey return to the roles he's always been good at.  Needless to say, these two kill it together. Of course, this is a DD movie, so the humour will be pretty dumb. I, myself, like this humour very much at times, which means I just adored the humour. Some parts even had me in stitches, and just like the pissing in a beer bottle and "we called it a **** scene from the first one, there's some huge laughs here that I will remember for months. The humour doesn't always hit as hard as it should, but all the other big laughs mostly made up for that. If you love the first DD, you will enjoy this one. If you weren't really a big fan of it, you're not gonna enjoy this one. To be honest, the only hugely positive things I found out of this movie were the duo of Jeff Daniels and Jim Carrey and the humour/laughs. But isn't that all you ever want out of Dumb and Dumber films? In my mind, YES.

Watched this movie couple of weeks ago... forgot to review. Don't let those critic scores fool you! This movie is hillarious! Tons of funny scenes, decent story and great acting make the second part of Dumb and Dumer worse than the first one but diffenitely better than most of the comedies from the last couple of years!

A pretty good movie, I don't understand all the negative reviews on the critics side, well everyone has opinions. My only problem was at times the movie got a little boring but I'm pretty sure you'll enjoy it

Sadly the charm of the original Dumb and Dumber wasn't replicated here. When the jokes work, they work pretty well. I think there were only a couple moments where I actually laughed out loud, though. When the jokes don't work however, its just embarrassing and awkward to watch. This movie just wasn't clever or funny enough to be warranted. It's not the triumphant return any of us hoped for. That being said, it can still be fun to watch Harry and Lloyd being idiots. If you're willing to take it for it's faults and just enjoy Jim Carrey and Jeff Daniels, then its worth a watch. I wouldn't spend money on it in theaters though.
A really good nostalgic kick back to the time when comedy didn't equal rom-com but plain (brainless at moments, granted) fun. Went in expected much worse movie and was pleasantly surprised.
A few years too late.

Predictable plot but I thought it was hilarious. I laughed through out and thought it did surprisingly well for a sequel to such a classic comedy. Honestly, Half the time I don't even agree with critic scores. They will praise the worst films and yet bash the decent ones. Dumb and Dumber To is a pretty enjoyable movie that is well worth the watch.
This is just, just too dumb.

This movie reminded me of 'A Million ways to die in the West ' if you have seen it you know that is a stupid comedy, The kind of stupid comedy that some say  "It lowers your I.Q" well Dumb & Dumber 2 could be called one of those.

Two friends (Jeff Daniels and Jim Carrey) fool each other. Jim Carrey is fooling presumably for twenty years and Jeff Daniels for the duration of the movie. Absolute nonsense, no scenario, pretended acting from everybody, silly traditional gestures, nothing more to write, does not deserve more than three lines.

'94 I saw a movie that hasn't aged a bit in my eyes, it's still one of the best comedies I've ever seen. This sequel is nowhere near it but it's still a great and wanted sequel. Loved it! It has a same chemistry and I had such a nostalgic feeling when those two idiots started to share their dialogues :) Guys have aged, and there are some over acting etc.. But it's a great film if you're a fan of the first film, and a good film if you just wanna see old school comedy with Jim Carrey.
One of the worst films that I have seen in many years. It was just crap, with a weak story line, and the jokes were poor, and I ended up 'clock watching'. One to avoid.

Dumb and Dumber is one of my favorite comedies of all time so these characters really do mean something to me.  That's why after 20 years and many Farrelly brothers flops later I was worried that all the magic would be gone.  After seeing this lazy, unfunny, and cringe worthy movie my fears have been realized.  While Carrey and Daniels try to bring these characters back it's a total disaster mainly because of the Farrelly Brothers terrible story.  All the best jokes are in the trailer with that I didn't laugh once.  A train wreck from the start Dumb and Dumber To fails in every way that the first one succeded, making it the worst movie of 2014 so far.  F

This movie is awful.  The first one is funny with stupid humor  The 2nd is raunchy and bad acting.  A shame and a waste of money.  It is full of ridiculous "dumb" jokes that are a real let down from the first show.  It also is not a pg-13!!!!

You know It's not the best movie but its what I wanted. I wanted a stupid movie that at times is just too much, but that's what I wanted being a fan of the fist movie. So if you are a fan of the first that wants just grade A stupid you might like it, if not...don't bother.

Jeff Daniels didn't disappoint.. I had a lot more faith in Jim Carrey than I should have though.. It felt like he took Lloyd from Dumb and Dumber and characterized him to an unbelievably ridiculous level where I cringed at every line of dialog. Maybe the big mistake was watching the first one prior to watching this one.. I hope that Jim can get the funny back.

I have to say that the overall vibe I think most fans will take away from this movie is disappointment. It’s a funny movie, it’s great to see these characters back and a lot of their jokes do hit because Jeff Daniels and Jim Carrey work magic together. But is the movie as funny as the original? Probably not. It does feel a little bit forced. There are times when a lot of the jokes fall flat, especially in the third act and once they actually meet the girl they’re searching for, I think she was pretty much not funny at all.

Just a poorly done movie the first one was good this was just a weak retry. I think there were a couple of well crafted sections but for the most part it lacked the great original comedy and creativity.

WOW. The director to this fine, fine movie is a genius!! I like it how they put to instead of two. I was laughing before I ever had the pleasure to watch this movie! I went to the theaters my myself because I am lonely but I still had a good time! Fantastic!

This movie was an utter piece of crap... so much so that movies like this remind me why I stopped going to movies around 2011. The only reason I went to see this garbage movie was because my friend convinced me to go with him. We both are fans of the first movie and were holding out on the idea that maybe it wouldn't be a total loss. It was.
Dumb and Dumber To underestimates the viewer's IQ. But this 109 mins long funfest is amusing yet disgusting, although humorous, I did not LOL not once throughout the whole movie.
This one is no where near as funny as the comedy classic that is Dumb and Dumber, but Dumb and Dumber To does have its fair share of chuckle worthy moments sprinkled in here and there.
Dumb and Dumber To says all you need to know about the film in the title and yet still manages to be incredibly lazy, unfunny, and a cringe worthy movie. Just one big embarrassment of a film.
Dyshpo's Law

Easily best comedy of the year! I don't understand this new trend in Hollywood.. critics love **** comedies like The Hangover, Neighbors, 21 Jump Street! I hated every single one of these movies, they're not even movies, they're unfunny and sad attempt to make something new, guess what, you've failed, those movies suck!!!!! Dumb and Dumber & Dumb and Dumber To are real comedies!!!

I finally saw Dumb & Dumber To today and I, like everyone else it seems, am really disappointed. I think the worst part is that they seem to have forgotten how the characters were originally. They seem pretty mean-spirited compared to the first movie... which removes a lot of what makes them likeable in the first place. It removes some of what was the heart of their friendship before. Sure, Lloyd held out on those extra gloves while Harry was freezing... but it was only because he was dumb. And sure Harry went after Mary when he knew Lloyd wanted her but he didn't intend to originally it just sort of happened.

I really was looking forward to this movie but then I read horrible reviews well rest asure the movie is not as bad as everyone is making it out to be I mean I didn't laugh constantly but it was a few good laughs thrown in to the flick and good heart and adventure as well Harry's "fake daughter" was just too cute and too much like the guys for words to describe would have made a perfect family I say see this movie regardless of what the reviews say u will find that u made a really smart choice if u do ps 22 jump street was a better sequel but this was however still grade  b fun

I Had an awesome time with this sequel. Funny as all get out. I think it had more laughs than the original. All in all a great sequel in my opinion. I'm so glad they finally got it made. Just plain FUNNY and AWESOME.

I haven't seen this Dumb & Dumber sequel and, because I hold the original in such high regard, I don't plan to.  But I think at least one reviewer here got it right in pointing out that the critics hated the original, giving it a Metascore of 39.  The critics can't have it both ways.  If a movie they ripped on 20 years ago turned out to be a comedy classic ("So you're telling me there's a chance" is still one of the greatest, most cited, lines ever), what are we to make of the sequel's Metascore of 35?
What is wrong with people. This is amazing. Trust me, if your not bothered with "character development"

Ok i enjoyed Dumb and Dumber the first one , the prequel  'When Harry Meet Lloyd' which  i don't want want to talk about never !!!!!!!. So when i found out about this sequel i was excited but it was not funny well the joke were a C+  i enjoy the first Dumb and Dumber its more funny also it has a good quality then the 20 years later version. What happen Farrelly Brothers? you written so many good comedies example' There's something about Mary'  , 'Me Myself and Irene' , Three Stooges , Kingpin the jokes got old so as Carey and Daniels. Grade C

Not even close as being as good as the first one but still laughed a lot. This movie is way stupider than the first movie but it wasn't as funny. There were many jokes that did hit but many of them missed too. I still enjoyed it as they brought a lot of stuff back from the first one to bring back memories. You will enjoy this movie a bit at least if you liked the first movie.
Great film with lot of funny moments and laughs (especially when your intoxicated and watching it with other people), worth a watch. Plenty of fan service, poor taste, bad jokes and other dumbfoolery
Mother of God... Maybe it will finally be over. One was enough and this franchise needs to be put down for good. I don't have anything redeeming to say about this pile of excrement.
Jesus Christ have some appreciation people.
It was nasty and I know that's how Dumb And Dumber is supposed to be like. But just plain childish and unfunny. I walked out about half of the movie. The first one was OK.

Последние комедии и отечественного, и зарубежного производства в своём большинстве в основе своей имеют юмор, который исходит из трусов или так или иначе связан с темой данной. И тем приятнее обнаруживать, что есть фильмы, которые заставляют смеяться не затрагивая особо данную тематику или не так акцентируя на этом внимания, не делая точкой опоры, на которой держится весь юмор в фильме. Тупой и еще тупее 2 оказался из числа таких фильмов.

Like most sequels, it brings back the memorable look and feel of the film, but never seem to pull it off better first one. However "Dumb and Dumber To" still has good laughs behind it, just not a sequel that improves on anything.
"Dumb and Dumber To" 10 Scale Rating: 6.0 (Decent) ...

Dumb and Dumber To results in a very schizophrenic sequel.  It seems, at times, to cannibalize the original feature, while often feeling rather authentic. Crafted in its proud, shoddy digital photography, it tends to insert contemporary elements (from the Breaking Bad reference to the film soundtrack) in a context wholly immersed in self-referential humour. Bu at times it truly delivers.

While this movie was enjoyable at times, it is a classic example of a movie that tries way too hard to match its predecessor.  The first movie was original and the script wasn't forced.  Most of this movie's script is like the writers were constipated of ideas and forced some stuff out.  Granted their are some funny moments, but they are about as raunchy as you can be.  The whole basis of the story also leaves the viewer saying "this is stupid" at the end of the movie.  It is basically a representation of how downhill American humor is going.

While the first film was not the intelligent man's comedy fest, it had its moments where it would step up to the plate and would hit a home run. But in the sequel, we see many attempts at the plate that either end up being foul balls or just plain strike outs.

A lot of people are saying that if you allow yourself to lower your I.Q and open yourself up to the idea that you're not watching Citizen Kane, this belated sequel will serve you well. But unfortunately, for even those of that disposition, Dumb and Dumber To is not a tragically bad film because it allows its self to be juvenile, but because every gag is in appalling taste, and it mainly feels like a desperate attempt to rekindle the magic of the original.

Dumb and Dumber 1 is one of those movies that you smile the moment you see re-runs on TV, it brings to your memory all these funny silly moments that you loved and enjoyed that you tend to remind people about. However, "Dumb and Dumber to" doesn't live up to the standard it set and the comedy bits are far in between. I do like the characters but overall it fell short on delivery.

In fact the long awaited sequel has finally arrived but there are some problems with this long-awaited comedy. You see, Dumb and Dumber is actually my best comedy of all time because of its obvious reasons but this time, I feel disappointed because this is far more different than the other two series. It's a bit watered down and the comedy feeling is a bit lost. Hence, of course it is still a comedy but not much as I expected before.

This was not a very good movie or sequel.  Sometimes you can tell that people come back to do a movie because they loved doing it the first time, maybe because they wrote it, maybe because they loved the cast.  This looks like Jim Carrey hadn't had a hit in a while and had a free week to film.

Dumb and Dumber to is one of those sequels that look like a better than the original, but is more of how most sequels end up-why did this happen? Also, most of the jokes are unfunny, and some scenes are forgettable, with stupid and grose jokes.

I like the first movie alot, it's one of the best comedies of all time in my eyes. This movie, not so much. The chemistry was still there and I laughed quite a lot but the last 20 minuets makes the whole point of the movie irrelevant. Also the person who plays Penny cannot act, she was annoying

I watched the original at least a dozen times and it all felt natural, which made it so great. This sequel attempt felt forced and full of wasted and unnatural punchlines.  I still remember all the best lines and scenes from the original, yet none from the sequel.

A belated sequel to the surprising Farrelly Brothers hit, this basically treads the same ground only its core audience is now a lot older and may expect more. Lloyd and Harry are looking for Harry's daughter in order to get her to donate her kidney which leads them to a technology expo and gets them involved in a murder plot. A lot of it is crass and obvious, but two jokes (one about Surrey, and the other about aspergers) almost make it worth the price of admission
This was WAY funnier than the first one. I saw it at the Cinemark with my friends and it was one of the best comedy movies out there. If you guys and gals have time, watch it, it is the BEST.
I wasn't really expecting much from this movie, but i was pleasantly suprised it didn't suck as much as i heard. I got a few good laughs out of it but overall it was an average movie.
Harry's Dad: "We loved you, Harry".
Rented it online and got to about 2/3 through it. Horribly boring. Not many laughs in it. Surpricing to see Jim Carrey not funny. Overall just ... sad really.
It was awful! The jokes weren't funny at all. As a comedy, it was supposed to make you laugh and feel relaxed, instead I almost fell asleep. An absolute failure!

This is not supposed to be an intelligent thought provoking movie.  I forgot what the original was like and sequels are generally never as good as the original.  But for $1.64 at Redbox for 90 min or so of corny humor it is a winner to me.  I probably wouldn't want to pay $10 or more at the movies, but for not even $1.75  it did the job I expected it to do.   Maybe people should look at it as a standalone comedy for the small price of a rental and not compare it to the original.
I've seen some pretty bad revisits before. This is literally the worst. It's so bad that it's made me dislike the original. **** this ****

1/5★ The Farrelly Brothers have not made a good movie in years. Their particular gross-out brand of humor has faded in popularity and their gags are more miss than hit. The titular characters, played by the indefatigable Jim Carrey and Jeff 'Will McAvoy' Daniels, are as idiotic as ever, but they are wrinkled, out of date and a little bit sad.

Dumb and Dumber To is a comedy sequel, so I wasn't expecting much when I watched this movie. Fortunately, it slightly surpassed my expectations. It had a lot of good moments and parts where I laughed out loud. But, there are some long, unfunny stretches in the film. All I can say is, if you are a fan of the first Dumb and Dumber, you should check this one out. 6/10

THIS IS THE BEST COMEDY I HAVE EVER WATCHED THIS YEAR!!!  The family and I loved it!!:) Even my little sister and brother who are age 8 and 10 enjoyed this! I loved and laughed every second of this movie and I really hope they make another one!! Fingers crossed!

Similar to the sequel to Anchorman, this was done way too long after the original. This film was poorly put together, and the original comedy was totally gone. It felt like the director said "just put any thing stupid you can in this" and that was that. Really disappointed to say the least.
Dumb and Dumber To wasn't the film I was expecting. For starters it was dry and unfunny. Watching my childhood get pooped on wasn't a very nice feeling.

Gutsplitting funny. That the morons consider comic "timing" the amount of time the joke takes - and the more the better, like 20 years - is a gasser. Except the regulator was removed from the crassometer -  the guy who says we're trying to get'em to laugh, not to vomit, was tossed out the window on this one. Sandler and Shneider would be embarrassed. Well, not Shneider.

Dumb and dumber to in its first 40 minutes is actually funny but then descends into mean spirited humour that is really dumb and unfunny and turns the characters of harry and Lloyd into unlikable dickwads.

If you like the original you will NOT enjoy this movie. Unless you're addicted to sniffing gas, or some other kind of brain rotting intoxicant, you probably won't find anything to laugh about here. I relaxed my standards and was just looking for something to like. But I found nothing. This movie is bad in a way I cannot seem to find the adequate words to describe. It's cheap, and not just dumb, actually cringe worthy the whole way through. No effort. It's kind of like Anchorman 2. Everything from everyone not channeling the spirit of their original characters, oddly filmed with a stupidly high fram rate and unwelcomed style in general. In motion it looks like a British soap opera, makes me almost sick to look at it.

The first Dumb an Dumber proved a hit with audiences. Apparently watching Daniels and Carrey bumble around like idiots onscreen, involving themselves in gross out gags and making stupid faces made it something of a comedy classic. I personally was not as amused. Given the fact that I didn't like the first movie I had no real interest in this sequel. Imagine my surprise when I found out just how much I liked it.

As a standalone movie it's good, but it PALES in comparison to the original 90s classic. WAY too many scenes involve Lloyd and Harry in a car. The humor is like Deadpools style: either not that funny or bursting out laughing. The story feels........ off for some reason. The characters had no personality whatsoever, just being your typical people/rich people. Some may enjoy it, but for me it's best left forgotten.

I wasn’t even 10 when the first Dumb & Dumber was released in 1994. Twenty years ago, Jim Carrey was the hero of a generation: he was Ace Ventura and The Mask, and every kid at school imitated his catchphrases at every occasion. We still didn’t know about the awful films that would come in the following couple of years (before he found his redemption with The Truman Show), and leave an indelible mark on his career. His co-star was Jeff Daniels, who also appeared in Speed, but didn’t have a fraction of Carrey’s fame. Daniels reportedly agreed to get involved in Dumb & Dumber for $50,000 (while Carrey’s salary was around $7 million, nearly half of the whole film’s budget), just because he was keen to star in a comedy. By pairing Carrey (Lloyd) and Daniels (Harry), and having them perform a bunch of idiotic stunts, the then newcomers Bobby and Peter Farrelly created one of the most iconic slapstick comedies of the ‘90s, and achieved an incredible financial success. I’m not sure I would find it as funny now, but it still is significantly better than its simple-minded and slack sequel, Dumb and Dumber To.
This is just funny as the original Dumb and Dumber. If you want to laugh your hearts out, check this movie.
Hát nem gondoltam volna, hogy lesz folytatása a filmnek. De megérte a két "örök (ökör) gyereket" ismét megnézni 20 év után "újból" :)

After twenty long years, Harry and Lloyd are back AND... most people didn't care. Despite the success of the first film, the Farrelly's waited far too long to bring the pair back. Everyone who grew up watching the first film are adults now, and the demographic they were going for with a PG-13 rating, has no idea who Harry and Lloyd are, hence the disappointing numbers at the box office. In this long awaited sequel, Harry (Jeff Daniels) is in need of a kidney and finds out that his only living relative is a daughter he never knew about. That's all it take to get Harry and Lloyd back on the road for more antics AND... they tried too hard. The original film was legitimately laugh out loud funny, while it's sequel may lead to a snicker or two. The beauty of the original is that it was so simple and so stupid that you couldn't help but laugh. The new one is full of long running pranks, modern slang the pair don't understand, and just obvious jokes. There's absolutely no spontaneity, like when Harry chucks the salt over his shoulder or Lloyd puts laxative in Harry's tea. That's not the only issue here, as the bad guys are kind of the biggest joke in the movie and Lloyd finally crosses the line from cute to creepy. The bottom line, I loved seeing Carrey and Daniels together again and I enjoyed the parallels to the first film, but aside from a few misunderstandings and a line here or there, this film isn't even close to being the film fans waited twenty years to see.
Everyone might end up having a few laughs, but Dumb and Dumber To recycles the same old jokes from the first movie and doesn't feel relevant compared to the original.

This film was never going to be as good as the first Dumb and Dumber film so before I watched the second one I kept an open mind and didn't expect to much. There was always going to be a second film made it was just the case of when not if. So... to the film itself. There are some really funny moments and a lot of reminiscing from the first film which I feel was done really well. They play out scenes which are a slight copy cat of the first film but still makes you laugh. There is the odd moment where you do get a little bit bored but this only happens a few times. Its easy to compare this film to the first one and obviously this one isn't as good but I would still recommend watching as there are some really funny moments.
anyway i love this movie as much as its 1st part.I love jim carrey and Jeff Daniels.These two are actually my favorite actors since its 1st part.love you guys.
